title: Hierarchical Label Propagation: A Model-Size-Dependent Performance Booster for AudioSet Tagging
author: Ludovic Tuncay (IRIT, Universite de Toulouse, CNRS), Etienne Labbe (IRIT, Universite de Toulouse, CNRS), Thomas Pellegrini (IRIT, Universite de Toulouse, CNRS), ...
relevance_why: The hierarchical label propagation technique may enhance label consistency and improve model performance in audio tagging tasks, which is directly relevant to Haohe Liu's focus on audio processing and generation.
background: Hierarchical label propagation addresses inconsistencies in audio event labeling to improve multi-label classification performance for audio datasets like AudioSet.
contribution: This paper introduces Hierarchical Label Propagation to solve label inconsistency issues in multi-label audio tagging, achieving a significant increase in positive labels and performance improvements across versions of audio models.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods often struggle with noisy label data and fail to leverage hierarchical relationships in labels effectively.
technical_comparison.novelty: This approach systematically propagates positive labels up an ontology, addressing label quality directly while maintaining a clear structure.

key_innovation: The systematic upward propagation of labels helps to enrich training data while minimizing the impact of sibling node ambiguity.
real_world_impact: This method could lead to improved audio tagging performance in applications utilizing large-scale datasets, benefiting various fields from multimedia content organization to automated audio analysis.
limitations: HLP may propagate existing label errors upward, potentially exacerbating underlying noise issues in the dataset.

new_terms.Hierarchical Label Propagation: **Hierarchical Label Propagation** is a technique that utilizes the hierarchical structure of label systems to improve the accuracy and consistency of label assignments by propagating information from specific labels to more general categories.

open_sourcing: Our source code will be made available on GitHub.
